newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: JSE gives go-ahead for Vestacor, M&A rescue.
newsitem.headline: JSE gives go-ahead for Vestacor, M&A rescue.

text.p: A rescue bid for South Africa's Vestacor Ltd, the pyramid holding firm for M&A, has been given the go-ahead by the Johannesburg Stock Exchange, the firms said on Friday.
M&A's main unit is Office Mart Ltd, which has been liquidated causing the suspensions of the listings of Vestacor and M&A.
However, the JSE has agreed to reinstate the listings in its Cash Companies sector after a resuce bid was received from a consortium led by Gerald Rubenstein.
The consortium has agreed to purchase outstanding claims against Vestacor and will subscribe for 120 million new Vestacor shares for five million rand cash.
It has also purchased all claims against M&A and will subscribe for 321.87 million M&A shares for a further five million rand cash.
Under the terms of the rescue bid the firms' listing will be suspended again should they not acquire viable assets within six months of relisting.
